data.title: Eight Things We Know About Harry Styles's Solo Project

data.description: A Sign Of The Times. Harry posted the cover art on Instagram on Friday afternoon. It's brooding, yet artistic and while it doesn't feature as much Harry as we would like - it's a soon-to-be an iconic image that will no doubt be... a sign of the times.
data.title: The First Single Is Going To Be Called...

data.description: Even since 2010 - when his sartorial dexterity extended little further than a military boot and jersey draped scarf - Harry has always had a keen eye for a strong aesthetic. From his immaculate (often cryptic) Instagram account to his directional (sorry) approach on the red carpet, it's undeniable that Harry's new project will be executed with a keen eye. Just look to the clip of the material we've already seen - it's a dead ringer for a broody, moody Saint Laurent campaign.
data.title: It's Going To Look Great

data.description: Having already penned several songs during his One Direction days, it's likely that Harry has upped his involvement in the actual song-making process for his eponymous work.
data.title: Harry's Name Won't Just Be On The Album Sleeve

data.teaser: A khaki army jacket goes with everything

data.title: 12 J Crew Styling Tricks Jenna Lyons Taught Us
How To Take A Great Profile Picture

data.description: Lighting is 90 per cent of what makes a great photograph. Maybe even 100 per cent. Often moving a few feet in one direction can completely change the look and feeling of an image. As a general rule, direct light is harsh and less flattering then soft filtered light. If you have a moment that you want to capture, take a minute to look around and see where the best light falls. If you're taking a portrait outside, look for a large white wall to use as a reflector to make even light. Often glass buildings can create interesting effects when the sun is bouncing off. Getting as much light as possible when you're indoors is key for a strong photograph. Use a room with many windows and lots of natural light rather than turning on more lamps. For me, the best light is actually not where you'd expect (see next tip).
data.title: Find The Best Light

data.description: My favourite type of light is found in the shadows. On a bright, sunny day it's excellent to photograph in the shade of a building or inside, by a window. Standing the subject on the edge of the light with the darkest point behind the subject will mean the person will be illuminated perfectly.
data.title: Find A Shadow

data.description: It's a well-known Kardashian fact, that all selfies must be taken in front of a window. N.B. This means facing the window, not the window behind you. Using the shade in the background creates the most flattering contrast and usually makes for an even skintone.
data.title: Find A Window

data.teaser: Whether you're a fan or not, there's no denying Melania takes a pretty mean profile picture - Vogue's street-style photographer tells you how to do the same

data.title: How To Take A Great Profile Picture

data.teaser: After building up its make-up and fragrance business in-house, Burberry has signed a deal with Coty, who will take on the exclusive global license to Burberry’s beauty business and inventory. It's an exciting move which will, we hope, see Burberry Beauty's already-excellent make-up offering be expanded further, and in new and interesting directions. Brilliant base products for a fresh and youthful glow? We'd like more of them. Excellent lipsticks, glosses and stains? We wouldn't say no to extra shades for our arsenal. As we wait to see what this new partnership will bring, here are five of the best Burberry Beauty products to get your hands on now.

data.description:
A multi-tasking beauty hero, the Fresh Glow Luminous Base makes an excellent primer, a perfect under-foundation illuminator and a brilliant strobing cream, ensuring that covetable “Burberry glow” every time.

Burberry Fresh Glow Luminous Fluid Base.

The Effortless Eyebrow Definer has a brush on one end and a powder-texture pencil on the other, allowing you to draw in individual hairs with true precision. The Barley shade is great for blondes.

Burberry Effortless Eyebrow Definer, £22.50.

Burberry’s Liquid Lip Velvets are some of the best liquid lipsticks we’ve tried, with a flawless matt finish, great staying power and an excellent colour range. Black Cherry is a beauty desk favourite.

Burberry Liquid Lip Velvet in Black Cherry, £26.

Perfect for creating that healthy, dewy radiance that all Burberry models seem to exude, the Fresh Glow BB Cream offers semi-sheer coverage and skincare benefits as well as SPF 20 protection.

Burberry Fresh Glow BB Cream, £30.

Foolproof contouring comes courtesy of Burberry’s Face Contour, which comes in a slimline pen perfect for subtle shading around the eyes and sculpting under the cheekbones. Doubles up as the perfect cream shadow. 

Burberry Face Contour, £25.
